subject: Hockey, Ice
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: John Paddock was promoted to coach of the Ottawa Senators yesterday after two seasons as an assistant. He takes over a team that reached the Stanley Cup finals this spring. Paddock, 53, is the sixth coach in franchise history. He is replacing Bryan Murray, who was promoted to general manager in mid-June. Paddock was coach of the Winnipeg Jets from 1991 to 1995, compiling a record of 106-138-37.
